item.title: Tika add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tika add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Tika add a quote by A.C. Grayling
item.description: "To read is to fly: it is to soar to a point of vantage which gives a view over wide terrains of history, human variety, ideas, shared experience and the fruits of many inquiries." -- A.C. Grayling

item.title: Tika add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tika add a quote by Ryunosuke Akutagawa
item.description: "A man sometimes devotes his life to a desire which he is not sure will ever be fulfilled. Those who laugh at this folly are, after all, no more than mere spectators of life." -- Ryunosuke Akutagawa

item.title: Tika add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Tika add a quote by Stéphane Mallarmé
item.description: "Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book." -- Stéphane Mallarmé

item.title: Tika add a quote by Leo Rosten
item.description: "O, to be sure, we laugh less and play less and wear uncomfortable disguises like adults, but beneath the costume is the child we always are, whose needs are simple, whose daily life is still best described by fairy tales." -- Leo Rosten

item.title: Tika add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Tika add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Well, my dear, take heart. Some day, I will kiss you and you will like it. But not now, so I beg you not to be too impatient." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Tika add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "And she's got brains enough for two, which is the exact quantity the girl who marries you will need." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Tika add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Tika add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Not knowing when the dawn will come I open every door." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Tika add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tika add a quote by Wilkie Collins
item.description: "The books - the generous friends who met me without suspicion - the merciful masters who never used me ill!" -- Wilkie Collins

item.title: Tika add a quote by R.A. Salvatore
item.description: "It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them." -- R.A. Salvatore

item.title: Tika add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Tika add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tika add a quote by Donald Bell
item.description: "If you say “I don't read” like it's something to be proud of, punch yourself in the face repeatedly." -- Donald Bell

item.title: Tika add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Tika add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Tika add a quote by Romain Rolland
item.description: "Be reverent before the dawning day. Do not think of what will be in a year, or in ten years. Think of to-day." -- Romain Rolland

item.title: Tika add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Tika add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You will lose someone you can’t live without,and your heart will be badly broken, and the bad news is that you never completely get over the loss of your beloved. But this is also the good news. They live forever in your broken heart that doesn’t seal back up. And you come through. It’s like having a broken leg that never heals perfectly—that still hurts when the weather gets cold, but you learn to dance with the limp." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Tika add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Tika add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "I'm always amazed at friends who say they try to read at night in bed but always end up falling asleep. I have the opposite problem. If a book is good I can't go to sleep, and stay up way past my bedtime, hooked on the writing. Is anything better than waking up after a late-night read and diving right back into the plot before you even get out of bed to brush your teeth?" -- John Waters

item.title: Tika add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "You have to remember that it is impossible to commit a crime while reading a book." -- John Waters

item.title: Tika add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "Nothing is more impotent than an unread library." -- John Waters

item.title: Tika add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Tika add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier
